intro: Lindernia alsinoides, commonly known as the Indian nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically purple or pink in color, which bloom during the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Lindernia alsinoides is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
